headline: Why Ford (F) Stock Is Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of automotive manufacturer Ford (NYSE:F) fell 3.2% in the afternoon session after the company disclosed a costly vehicle recall. The company announced it is recalling nearly 700,000 of its Bronco Sport, Escape, and Kuga SUVs due to faulty fuel injectors that could crack and leak fuel, creating a potential fire risk. Ford estimates the cost of this "field service action" will be approximately $570 million, a charge that will be reflected in its upcoming second-quarter results. This action

headline: Unity Software, Ford, silver: Trending tickers
summary: Here are some of the stocks on the move on Wednesday, July 16. Unity Software (U) shares are hitting 52-week highs after an analyst at Jefferies boosted their price target on the stock to $35 per share. Ford (F) is recalling nearly 700,000 SUVs over fuel leak concerns. Citi analysts think silver (SI=F) could hit $40 per ounce in the next few months. headline: Why Stellantis, Ford, and GM Stocks Aren’t Getting Hit By a French Scare
summary: Shares of French car maker Renault were plunging by the most since 2020 on Wednesday after it said profits and cash flow will be substantially lower than previously thought.  Renault  cited poor sales in June and a weakening market in France in particular.  The news was a big surprise because the car maker had recently been doing well despite worries of the impact of tariffs and trade wars.

headline: Ford recalls over 694,000 SUVs in US after year-long fuel leak probe
